thread.title: OU football secures two 2026 recruitment flips through Markel Ford, Jonathan Hatton Jr.
thread.title_full: OU football secures two 2026 recruitment flips through Markel Ford, Jonathan Hatton Jr.

author: Natalie Roe
title: OU football secures two 2026 recruitment flips through Markel Ford, Jonathan Hatton Jr.
text:
Class of 2026 safety Markel Ford has flipped his recruitment from Southern Methodist University to OU, per ON3’s Hayes Fawcett’s post on social platform X.
Boomer Sooner!!
— Markel “agentzer0” Ford (@MarkelFord8)[#agtg][https://t.co/tKfisGQLth][November 26, 2025]
Ford, a three-star prospect, is the No. 61 safety in his class and No. 84 player in Texas, according to 247Sports. Ford recorded a total of 56 tackles, seven tackles for loss, one forced fumble and one fumble recovery for John Horn High School in Mesquite, Texas, during his junior season.
OU also received another flip in the 2026 class with running back Jonathan Hatton Jr. changing his recruitment from Texas A&M University on Wednesday.
BREAKING: Four-Star RB Jonathan Hatton Jr. has Flipped his Commitment from Texas A&M back to Oklahoma, he tells me for
— Hayes Fawcett (@Hayesfawcett3)[@rivals]The 6’1 215 RB flipped from the Sooners to the Aggies in MarchHe’s the No. 5 RB in 2026 (per Rivals Industry)[https://t.co/BHPINucWrH][pic.twitter.com/so4T9FILgg][November 24, 2025]
Hatton, a four-star prospect, is the No. 5 running back in his class and No. 12 player in Texas, according to 247Sports. Hatton has rushed over 1,300 yards and 16 touchdowns as a senior at Steele High School in Cibolo, Texas.
OU ranks No. 16 spot in the 2026 class nationally, according to Rivals, and is ranked No. 8 in the Southeastern Conference.
This story was edited by Joshua McDaniel.
